dt: {bc}a condition of being able to resist a particular disease especially through preventing development of a pathogenic microorganism or by counteracting the effects of its products {dx}see also {dxt|active immunity||}, {dxt|passive immunity||}{/dx}

shortdef: the quality or state of being immune; especially : a condition of being able to resist a particular disease especially through preventing development of a pathogenic microorganism or by counteracting the effects of its products

dt: {bc}usually long-lasting immunity that is acquired through production of antibodies within the organism in response to the presence of antigens {dx}compare {dxt|passive immunity||}{/dx}

shortdef: usually long-lasting immunity that is acquired through production of antibodies within the organism in response to the presence of antigens

dt.t: Encouraging our families, friends and neighbors to get vaccinated adds layers of protection and helps us create {wi}community immunity{/wi}.
There is a level of vaccination that is needed to protect a community from an outbreak of disease. This is called "herd immunity" and sometimes, "{wi}community immunity{/wi}."

dt: {bc}short-acting immunity acquired by transfer of antibodies (as by injection of {d_link|gamma globulin|gamma globulin}) {dx}compare {dxt|active immunity||}{/dx}

shortdef: short-acting immunity acquired by transfer of antibodies (as by injection of gamma globulin)
